title: The rights you might not realize you have - Shannon Odell

multiple-choice.question: What type of movement has been sweeping courts around the world since 2015, with young plaintiffs suing their governments for inaction on tackling climate change?

options.label: A
options.text: Human rights movements focused on environmental issues

options.label: B
options.text: Environmental movements led by older generations

options.label: C
options.text: Youth-led climate change lawsuits against governments

options.label: D
options.text: Climate change advocacy campaigns through social media

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the first international document to outline human rights, adopted by the United Nations in 1948?

options.label: B
options.text: Paris Agreement on the Rights of the Child

options.label: C
options.text: Convention on the Rights of the Child

multiple-choice.question: What right was first incorporated into national constitutions and regional treaties in many countries within the Global South?
What is the estimated number of countries and jurisdictions that have enshrined the right to a healthy environment into national legislation?
What was the outcome of the Colombian Supreme Court's ruling in favor of the young plaintiffs in 2018?

options.label: A
options.text: The government was allowed to continue deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions

options.label: B
options.text: The government was legally obliged to reduce deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated number of human rights-based environmental cases that have been filed across the globe as of the summer of 2023?
What was the outcome of the UN General Assembly states' vote in 2022?

options.label: A
options.text: They voted to reject the right to a clean, healthy, and sustainable environment

options.label: B
options.text: They voted to keep human rights aligned to a changing world by recognizing the right to a clean, healthy, and sustainable environment

options.label: C
options.text: They voted to table the issue

options.label: D
options.text: They voted to hold a special session

multiple-choice.question: What is the estimated number of years by which the world's biodiversity could be wiped out if rapid and significant change is not made to address climate change?
What are the potential impacts of the loss of coastal habitats on people's lives?

options.label: A
options.text: It will make them more vulnerable to disease

options.label: C
options.text: It will leave them exposed to greater risks from destructive floods and hurricanes

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate goal of the court cases and human rights-based environmental movements?

options.label: A
options.text: To hold governments accountable for their actions

options.label: B
options.text: To give future generations a better chance to breathe clean air and live in a world with white rhinos, polar bears, and coral reefs

options.label: C
options.text: To reduce greenhouse gas emissions and stop deforestation
